info.longBusinessSummary: Uber Technologies, Inc. develops and operates proprietary technology applications in the United States, Canada, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Asia excluding China and Southeast Asia. It operates through three segments: Mobility, Delivery, and Freight. The Mobility segment connects consumers with a range of transportation modalities, such as ridesharing, carsharing, micromobility, rentals, public transit, taxis, and other modalities; and offers riders in a variety of vehicle types, as well as financial partnerships products and advertising services. The Delivery segment allows to search for and discover restaurants to grocery, alcohol, convenience, and other retails; order a meal or other items; and Uber direct, a white-label Delivery-as-a-Service for retailers and restaurants, as well as advertising. The Freight segment manages transportation and logistics network, which connects shippers and carriers in digital marketplace including carriers upfronts, pricing, and shipment booking; and provides on-demand platform to automate logistics end-to-end transactions for small-and medium-sized business to global enterprises. The company was formerly known as Ubercab, Inc. and changed its name to Uber Technologies, Inc. in February 2011. Uber Technologies, Inc. was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in San Francisco, California.

content.title: Uber stock jumps as Bill Ackman reveals $2.3B stake
content.description:
Uber (UBER) stock is climbing higher Friday afternoon following billionaire Bill Ackman's disclosure of a significant investment in the rideshare company. In a post on X (formerly Twitter), Ackman revealed that his firm, Pershing Square Capital Management, has built up a $2.3 billion stake — or 30.3 million shares — in the company since January, making the hedge fund the 12th largest shareholder.

Market Domination hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton analyze the development, examining the factors driving Pershing Square's substantial position in the company.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

This post was written by Angel Smith

content.title: Lyft Stock: Buy, Sell, or Hold?
content.summary: If you asked the professional analyst community about ride-sharing company Lyft (NASDAQ: LYFT), they'd collectively tell you that the stock has strong upside potential.  As of this writing, the average price target from analysts is $18.69 per share, according to the 32 analysts tracked by TipRanks.  To the contrary, I believe it has much higher upside potential than what it gets credit for, and I consequently believe that Lyft stock is a buy today.

content.title: Uber (UBER) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
content.summary: Shares of ride sharing and on-demand delivery platform Uber (NYSE:UBER) jumped 9.5% in the afternoon session after famous investor Bill Ackman revealed a 30.3m stake (shares) in the company, valued at roughly $2.3 billion. Ackman, who is the CEO of Pershing Square Capital Management, added that Uber is trading at a "massive discount" and can be considered "one of the best managed and highest quality businesses in the world."

content.title: Shares of Uber Surge After Billionaire Investor Bill Ackman Reveals Massive Stake
content.summary: Shares of the ride-sharing giant Uber Technologies (NYSE: UBER) rose nearly 9%, as of 12:38 p.m. ET today, after billionaire investor Bill Ackman revealed that his fund Pershing Square Capital Management had launched a new stake in the company that is now valued at over $2 billion.  On social media platform X, Ackman tweeted today that his fund began building the Uber position in early January and today owns 30.3 million shares.  Ackman said he was a day-one investor in Uber through a small investment he had in a venture fund, and has always been a big fan of the company.
